node.title: Covid-19: Daily community cases up to 17,522, 696 in hospital
node.description: There are 17,522 new cases of Covid-19 in the community today and 696 people in hospital.

node.title: Drilling campaign almost doubles Māui gas field's production - OMV
node.description: OMV says its in-fill drilling campaign at Māui A off the coast of Taranaki has almost doubled 2021 production levels, making it the country's largest gas field once more.

node.title: 'People's Convoy' rolls into Washington DC
node.description: More than a thousand large trucks, recreational vehicles and cars are gathering on the outskirts of Washington as part of a protest against Covid-19 restrictions.

node.title: Business leader backs Christopher Luxon's proposal to scrap all Labour-introduced taxes
node.description: The National Party's promise to scrap all the new taxes introduced by Labour since coming into power has been met with both praise and scepticism. Audio

node.title: Neurosurgeon taking Medical Council to court
node.description: A Hungarian neurosurgeon is taking the Medical Council to court, after they turned down his bid to work in a specialist role in New Zealand. Audio

node.title: Homicide investigators also looking into Taupō firearms incident
node.description: Detectives investigating the death of a man at Adelphi Motel in Taupō yesterday are also making inquiries into a firearm discharge last night.

node.title: Rockfall on near Kawerau Gorge brings SH6 down to one lane
node.description: State Highway 6 through Kawarau Gorge in Central Otago is down to one lane after fresh rockfall.

node.title: "War is madness, please stop": Pope Francis calls for peace in Ukraine
node.description: Pope Francis made a heartfelt plea for an end to a humanitarian crisis that has left "rivers of blood and tears" flowing in Ukraine.

node.title: City win Manchester derby
node.description: Manchester City restore their lead at the top of the Premier League with a derby victory and Arsenal add to Watford's woes.

node.title: Student claims hall removed them due to mental health problem
node.description: A Victoria University of Wellington student says their mental health worsened after being temporarily kicked out of their residential hall for feeling suicidal.

node.title: Conservative think tank's exclusive gathering will include Biden official — but not Trump
node.description: This year's guest list underscores how some GOP leaders are increasingly eager to move on from Trump.

node.title: Rocky Horror statue unveiled at new temporary site
node.description: The Riff Raff statue in Hamilton, celebrating The Rocky Horror Show and its creator Richard O'Brien, has a new home.

node.title: What does everyone want for Marlborough in the future?
node.description: Whisper the words "post-pandemic". Because while we're not there yet, some among us are planning for that special day.

node.title: The young Ukrainians battling pro-Russian trolls
node.description: What's it like being a young Ukrainian experiencing war while wading through chaos and misinformation online? Trolls have been prolific - and targeting young women across Ukraine.

node.title: Smokers more likely to get severely ill or die from Covid-19, research shows
node.description: WHO Director-General Dr Tedros Ghebreyesus last year warned smoking increased the severity of respiratory diseases and make people more likely to get gravely ill from Covid-19.

node.title: Russia limiting communications at nuclear facility, watchdog says
node.description: Ukraine's ambassador to the U.S. said Sunday that Ukraine is "ready for any option" to take back the plants, suggesting that a no-fly zone should be established.

node.title: How two offenders escaped a youth justice residence
node.description: A report obtained by RNZ has laid bare a litany of failures during the escape of two offenders from a youth justice residence in 2020.

node.title: Cautious optimism about the state of the coronavirus pandemic
node.description: Dr. Jon LaPook speaks with leading scientists and virus trackers to learn how they're looking for new coronavirus variants, and also for signs that the pandemic is winding down.

node.title: Ukrainians escaping war and joining the fight share their stories
node.description: Scott Pelley reports from a gateway to and from the war in Ukraine, the train station in Przemysl, Poland. Ukrainians there are defiant.

node.title: Rhythm and Vines Easter event cancelled due to Omicron outbreak
node.description: The Rhythm and Vines music festival, already rescheduled once, has been cancelled again. Audio

node.title: 'Help us if you can' - Nearly 1.5 million Ukrainians flee
node.description: US President Biden has spoken to Ukrainian President Zelensky, as refugees pour across Ukraine's borders on day 11 of invasion.

node.title: Omicron spread causing staff shortages in poultry industry
node.description: The poultry industry is reporting staff shortages of 45 percent at some Auckland plants as Covid-19 cases continue to rise.

node.title: Viv Beck standing for Auckland mayoralty
node.description: Beck says she's running for mayor because the city needs "someone with local and central government experience, business understanding, and someone who can work constructively with people to get the… Audio

node.title: Auckland trains running on reduced services due to Covid-related shortages
node.description: Trains on the Southern, Western and Eastern lines are at 20-minute intervals from today, up from the normal gap of eight to 10 minutes.

node.title: Consumer confidence down as Omicron cases increase
node.description: Consumer confidence has plummeted to a record low amid the rapid spread of the Omicron variant.

node.title: 6 dead, including some children, as tornado rips through Iowa, officials say
node.description: The victims ranged in age from two years old to 72 years old, officials said.

node.title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation" on March 6, 2022
node.description: On this "Face the Nation" broadcast, Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Ukrainian Ambassador Oksana Markarova join Margaret Brennan.

node.title: Covid-19: Cases dropping, but so are rapid testing results
node.description: The trend of falling daily cases Covid-19 should be treated with caution, the Ministry of Health says. RAT result reporting has dropped three days in a row, just like case numbers.

node.title: Cruise ship industry wants more certainty, sooner, about maritime border reopening
node.description: Cruise companies say they do not know when they will be able to return to Aotearoa and their preparation deadline is rapidly approaching.

node.title: Chatham Islands record first Covid-19 cases
node.description: The remote Chatham Islands have announced their first two cases of Covid-19 today.
